title: Understanding the concept
text: To calculate the change in entropy (∆S°), we use the relationship between Gibbs Free Energy (∆G°), enthalpy (∆H°), and entropy (∆S°) in thermodynamics:\n\n∆G° $$=$$ ∆H° - T∆S°

title: Rearranging the Equation
text: Rearrange the equation $$∆G\degree=∆H\degree-T∆S\degree$$ to solve for ∆S°:\n\n∆S° $$=$$ (∆H°-∆G°)/T

title: Calculate ∆H° for the Reactants and Products
text:

∆H° $$=$$ $$2MgO-2Mg+O_2$$ $$=$$ $$0$$ kJ/mol-(2 × $$(-601.70)$$ kJ/mol)
